MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Afterwards. We went out to the town for the time being to investigate this latest anomaly. There is no point in staying in the room and consulting with each other forever - The incident is happening outside at the scene, not inside the meeting room.

Incidentally, Carthage and the rest had somehow came to their senses after results of magical treatment and stomach cleansing. They're still pretty solemn - Perhaps it is the aftereffects of eating the suspicious chocolate, or from the pain of being whacked by Columbia's sword.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Carthage
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Ugh. My Captain is still throbbing.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Part-Dieu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Damn, you didn't have to hit me that hard... I didn't even do anything wrong, I was only mental, I'm not guilty.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Anzio
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Yes! That's completely unreasonable! For some reason, even this Sister here was beaten up even though no chocolate's eaten!

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Blanche
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: It can't be helped, petite Anzio also has that difficult condition - 'Ecstasy state', right? And because of that you almost became a lascivious woman, non?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Anzio
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I-I'm not lascivious! Sister here is a devout follower who lives a pure and righteous life! Oh, My Lord, why did you put Sister here through such an ordeal!?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hmph. I'm glad you're all having fun, but let's leave it at that - May I continue?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Blanche
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Leave it at that... While I'm pretty much no different, but Columbia you're sure doing things at your pace too.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Yeah. If you can't keep up with my pace, it's the world and everyone else's fault.
After that reckless statement, Columbia looked around and proudly proclaimed.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Right. I'm sure you've all seen for yourself the dangers of the chocolate personally.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Carthage
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Yes, painfully so... It would be a big problem if something like that was on the market, Even I, who am not very perceptive, can see that.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Excellent. So, first of all, We're going to find out how the chocolate is being distributed and destroy it. At the same time, we'll figure out the source of the chocolate - and destroy that, too. It's about both symptomatic and fundamental treatment.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Anzio
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Source? That's a strange way of putting it. Chocolate doesn't just spring up naturally, so wouldn't it be better to say 'manufacturer' or something like that?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Sure, if it's normal chocolate. But as far as I've been able to find out, there seems to be some kind of Phantom Mist-like substance inside that strange chocolate.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Part-Dieu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Phantom Mist...? D-Did I just seriously just licked that stuff?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Yes. If that chocolate is from Phantom Mist, it could really 'spring' from nowhere. It could even be just like Mist Monsters, something that's created by the Phantom Mist.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: As we saw on the academy grounds, those chocolate fused with the soil on the ground and turned into monsters. It's exactly like Mist Monsters themselves.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Instead of thinking that some criminals are manufacturing chocolate with aphrodisiacs in it - It's more reasonable to think of it as a bizarre phenomenon caused by Phantom Mist.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Part-Dieu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hmmm～... If that's the case, it's really, really tricky, oui? I've learned how to track down criminals, but when Phantom Mist is involved, normal police methods of investigation aren't applicable.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Really? I heard that you were a good investigator for the Interpol, so I was expecting a bit more from you.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Part-Dieu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: ...It doesn't mean I don't have any moves to make.

Perhaps having her pride provoked upon Columbia's agitation, Part-Dieu clicked her tongue and pulled out a noose from somewhere. It was probably one of her equipment as an investigator, likely to be used for subduing suspects.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Blanche
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Huh, what are you going to do with a rope like that? If you want 'that kind of play', you'll have to go to a shop that specialises in that kind of thing, oui?
Blanche works in a cabaret in the red-light district, she said this jokingly - But Part-Dieu ignored her. For some reason, she deftly hanged the noose around Carthage's and Anzio's necks.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Anzio
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Eh, what's going on? W-W-Why the noose around this Sister's neck!?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Carthage
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hmm. It's called hanging, isn't it? So I have committed a sin to that extent, right? I understand, as I have did such perverse things to the revered Teacher --

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Part-Dieu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Nothing of that sort. If that's what you meant, I'm just as guilty as you are... Also this isn't grave enough to get you hanged, and there are plenty of self-righteous people who're total perverts.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Anzio
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: W-why did you say that while looking at this Sister here! Sister is not lewd, it's all because of the devil who possessed this Sister here - It's the deviiil!?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: ...Hm. I'd like to hear your intentions, Miss Part-Dieu.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Part-Dieu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: This case resembles a narcotics case. The chocolates have a distinctive scent of spices, and when it comes to scent, the usual way is to solve with police dogs and have everyone follow them.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I see. But here's the problem, we don't have police dogs.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Part-Dieu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: So I'll let these two take their place.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Carthage
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Uh-huh, I understand. So we just have to follow the scent of that suspicious chocolate? I think that's probably possible.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Anzio
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Whaaa!? Aside from Carthage, who has superhuman sensory organs, Sister here doesn't have the sense of smell of a dog though!?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Part-Dieu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Fair enough, but you're unusually sensitive to stimuli, oui? Whenever that aphrodisiac-like smell of chocolate gets stronger, you're sure to get turned on and start being entranced.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: In other words, Anzio can be used as a chocolate detector, eh? Together with Carthage who seems to be able to track the scent, it makes sense that they could be good replacements for police dogs.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: And if they smell too much of the chocolate and get excited and go rowdy again, they can be controlled by the rope around their necks.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Part-Dieu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: That's what I meant. At the same time, I'll find out where they are and ask people in the neighbourhood. However, I'm not very good at communication, so I'd rather leave it to someone else to do the talking.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Blanche
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Ouuui, I can do that. I'm a pro at finding out what people wanted to hide and what not.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Everyone's the right person for their jobs. That's great. I made the right decision - I'm glad I chose you ladies for the Valentine Task Force.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Part-Dieu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hmph. Utter bull, you simply just picked at random from the nearest ones you saw.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: (......In fact, that's not actually true.)

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: (The center of this current anomaly, the chocolates, have the effect of aphrodisiac or love potions. Should Mr. Conductor accidentally ate such chocolate, which can force people to be aroused-)

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: (Mr. Conductor, driven by lust, will attack the nearest person. If the other person doesn't hate him, she may accept it. If that happens, they might even come into terms with him and might end up falling in love with him.)

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: (That's absolutely unacceptable. Which is why I chose these ladies - Those who don't seem to be interested in love.)

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: (As far as I can tell, Miss Anzio is a devout follower who abhors lust, while Miss Carthage is from the uncivilised Dark Continent, so she may not understand the intricacies of modern love and other processes.)

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: (Miss Part-Dieu seems to think that Mr. Conductor is her 'frère', brother, which means that her feelings for him are not heterosexual, but familial... As for Miss Blanche, while this is just my theory - She probably doesn't have any 'emotions'. Of course, that includes romance.)

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: (If these ladies are not interested in 'love' in that way - Even if they fall in love with Mr. Conductor because of the chocolate, they will understand after they come to their senses that it's because of the chocolate's effects.)

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: (They wouldn't accidentally misunderstand and really fall in love with Mr. Conductor and want to be his lover... No way. And vice versa, they should be able to reject him even if he falls in love with them.)

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: (That's why I've picked these ladies. Only they can be involved in the investigation of this case.)

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: (There's no need to cancel Valentine's Day if all I wanted is just to confiscate dangerous chocolates. I made that choice - On purpose.)

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: (I fell in love with Mr. Conductor, and he can fell in love with me... I'm the only one who can be Mr. Conductor's lover. I know I'm selfish, but hey, I'm actually that kind of person.)

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Columbia
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: ('That kind of person'... Is that why I can't make Mr. Conductor love me?)
